content.text:
# List All Worktrees

Displays all active feature worktrees and function workspaces with their current status.

üìã Active Worktrees:

  ‚úÖ automation-imp (‚ö™Ô∏è port 6944)
    Branch: feat-automations-improved
    Path: /Users/natedamstra/socialaize-worktrees/feature-automation-imp

  ‚úÖ onboarding-flow (‚ö™Ô∏è port 6943)
    Branch: feat-onboarding-flow
    Path: /Users/natedamstra/socialaize-worktrees/feature-onboarding-flow


üí° Commands:
  /cleanup-worktree <name>              - Remove a feature worktree
  /cleanup-functions-workspace <name>   - Remove a function workspace
  /worktree-status <name>               - Show detailed status

---

## What You'll See

### Feature Worktrees
- Feature name
- Port status (üü¢ running, ‚ö™Ô∏è not running)
- Branch name
- File path

### Function Workspaces
- Workspace name
- Primary function
- Number of related functions

---

## Available Commands

After listing, you can:
- `/cleanup-worktree <name>` - Remove a feature worktree
- `/cleanup-functions-workspace <name>` - Remove a function workspace
- `/worktree-status <name>` - Show detailed status for a worktree

I can see you have two active feature worktrees:

## Active Worktrees

1. **automation-imp** (Port 6944, not running)
   - Branch: `feat-automations-improved`
   - Location: `~/socialaize-worktrees/feature-automation-imp`

2. **onboarding-flow** (Port 6943, not running)
   - Branch: `feat-onboarding-flow`
   - Location: `~/socialaize-worktrees/feature-onboarding-flow`

Both worktrees are set up but neither has a dev server currently running. 

Would you like to:
- Check detailed status of either worktree (`/worktree-status <name>`)
- Start working in one of them
- Clean up an unused worktree (`/cleanup-worktree <name>`)
- Create a new feature worktree (`/worktree-feature <feature-name>`)

id like to work on feature-automation-imp worktree

content.text: I'll help you get started with the `automation-imp` worktree. Let me check its detailed status first.

# Worktree Status

Shows comprehensive status information for a feature worktree.

**Arguments:** `automation-imp`

Please use the Bash tool to run:
```bash
~/.local/bin/socialaize-worktree/worktree-status.sh automation-imp
```

---

## Usage Example

```bash
/worktree-status user-auth
```

---

## Status Information Shown

### Working Tree Status
- ‚úÖ Clean (no uncommitted changes)
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Modified files (with count)

### Remote Sync
- ‚úÖ In sync with remote
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Behind remote (commits to pull)
- üì§ Ahead of remote (commits to push)
- ‚ö†Ô∏è No remote tracking branch

### Dev Server
- üì¶ Running on port (with PID)
- üì¶ Not running (port assigned)

### Statistics
- Files changed vs main branch
- Commits ahead of main
- Last commit time

### Pull Request Status
- PR number and state (if `gh` CLI available)
- PR title

---

## Next Steps

The status will suggest actions:
- Commit uncommitted changes
- Push unpushed commits
- Pull latest changes
- Create a pull request

---

## Requirements

- **Basic**: Git repository info
- **Optional**: `nc` or `lsof` for port checking
- **Optional**: `gh` CLI for PR information

content.text:
Great! Here's the status of the `automation-imp` worktree:

## Status Summary

‚úÖ **Branch**: `feat-automations-improved`  
‚úÖ **Clean working tree** - No uncommitted changes  
‚úÖ **In sync with remote**  
üì¶ **Dev server**: Not running (port 6944 assigned)

## Stats
- **111 files changed** from main branch
- **11 commits ahead** of main
- Last commit was **6 days ago**

## Ready to Work

To start working in this worktree:

```bash
cd ~/socialaize-worktrees/feature-automation-imp
npm run dev:worktree  # Starts dev server on port 6944
```

The worktree is ready to go with a clean state. You could also consider creating a PR since you have 11 commits ready:

```bash
gh pr create --base main --head feat-automations-improved
```

What would you like to work on in this worktree?
